terms.definition: Quality Assurance - the systematic process of ensuring that products or services meet specified requirements and standards
Printed Circuit Board - a board that connects electronic components using conductive tracks, pads and other features etched from copper sheets
A system that tracks and manages changes to documents or code over time, allowing users to access previous versions and manage updates
A system that stores all documentation in a single, accessible location rather than scattered across multiple platforms or departments
The ability for multiple users to work on and edit documents simultaneously with changes visible instantly to all participants
Pre-programmed sequences of tasks that execute automatically based on triggers or conditions, reducing manual intervention
Electronic signatures that authenticate the identity of the signer and ensure document integrity using cryptographic methods
A chronological record of all activities, changes, and access events related to a document or system for compliance and tracking purposes
The systematic monitoring and documentation of adherence to regulatory requirements, industry standards, and internal policies
Restriction of Hazardous Substances - a European Union directive that restricts the use of specific hazardous materials in electrical and electronic products
Institute for Printed Circuits - an organization that develops standards for the electronic interconnection industry
A systematic process of identifying the underlying cause of a problem or defect to prevent recurrence
The process of different organizational departments working together and sharing information to achieve common goals
Structured processes that define how documents are created, reviewed, approved, and maintained within an organization
Software as a Service - a cloud-based software delivery model where applications are hosted remotely and accessed via the internet
